decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.

Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [TRICON/113FD/201 A, TRICON/113FD/203 A, Location Plan and Reasonable Exception Statement. Received on 13/08/2024; Fire Safety Statement. Received 21/08/2024; TRICON/113FD/200 A, TRICON/113FD/202a B, TRICON/113FD/202 C, TRICON/113FD/204 B, TRICON/113FD/205 B, TRICON/113FD/206 B and TRICON/113FD/207 C. Received 13/11/2024].

Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - The materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the development hereby permitted shall match those used in the existing building, unless otherwise shown on the approved plans.

Reason: In order to safeguard the appearance of the area.

Condition : 4 - No additional windows or openings shall be formed in any side elevation of the development hereby permitted.

Reason: In order to protect neighbours' privacy.

Condition : 5 - Prior to first use of the crossover hereby approved, the existing vehicular access at rear of the site and adjacent to the back garden shall be permanently closed and the kerb and footway reinstated, so that it cannot be used as an access across the pavement.

Reason: In order to enhance the pedestrian environment and to confine vehicular access to the permitted points in order to ensure that the development does not prejudice the free flow of traffic or highway safety along the adjacent highway.

Condition : 6 - Either side of the vehicle access hereby approved, visibility splay areas (the depth measured from the back of the footway and the widths outwards from the edges of the access, with a splay of at least 2.4 metres x 2.4 metres) shall be provided before the access and parking area is brought into use. 

A low boundary wall and pedestrian gate, no greater than 600 mm in height, shall be erected along the remainder the frontage. The visibility splay areas shall be kept clear of any obstructions to visibility greater than 600 mm in height, including shrubs, planting, boundary walls, fences, gates, other means of enclosure or other structures or objects at all times.

Reason: To ensure adequate visibility for drivers entering and leaving the site in the interests of pedestrian and vehicle safety.

Condition : 7 - The hardstanding hereby permitted shall be made of porous materials, or include provision to direct surface water run-off to a permeable or porous area or surface within the application site, in accordance with DCLG Guidance on Permeable Surfacing of Front Gardens (2008) before the crossover hereby permitted is first brought into use. The run-off shall not drain into any other foul or surface water drainage system.

Reason: To reduce surface water run-off and the associated pressure on local drainage systems and so prevent flooding.
description: Erection of single storey side and rear extension including formation of crossover and alteration of the front fore court to the house.
